name: Double bubble conjecture
rephrased: The Double Bubble Conjecture states that the minimal surface area configuration for enclosing two separate volumes in 3D space is a double bubble shape consisting of three spherical caps meeting along a shared circle at 120-degree angles.
implication_form: If two volumes are enclosed by a surface in 3D space, then the configuration with the minimal surface area is the standard double bubble shape.
posed_by: The conjecture refers to the widely believed minimal surface configuration, but specific attribution to original proposers is unclear; it emerged from the study of soap films and minimal surfaces.
solved_by: Michael Hutchings, Frank Morgan, Manuel Ritor√©, and Antonio Ros (proven in 2000)
